backgroundRationale: The goal of the Salmon ISEMP project is to measure the freshwater productivity of salmonids for the purposes of evaluating the effectiveness of habitat actions at improving freshwater productivity and to determine the relationships between status and trends in habitat quality and availability and status and trends of salmonid freshwater productivity. Effectively measuring freshwater productivity is complicated by the fact the distribution of juvenile salmonids is largely unknown for much of their life history. Further, until recently, the application of unique marks has been largely limited to juveniles greater than 60mm fork length. In order to address these complexities, juvenile sampling associated with the Salmon ISEMP is distributed using a spatially-balanced design (generalized random tessellation survey (GRTS). This protocol focuses on how sampling effort is distributed, criteria for rejecting probabilistically selected sites, and methods for juvenile capture and tagging at remaining sites.

objectives:
1. Estimate life-stage specific population estimates at the site and tributary scale
2. Estimate survival at multiple temporal and spatial scales including tributary and watershed.
dataHandlingConsiderations: Field data collection is managed using hand-held dataloggers. All data is uploaded to the ISEMP Roving Survey Database and data quality checked using standardized queries.
qualityControlConsiderations: All data is checked during field entry using controls on the hand-held datalogger. Once in the database, data quality is maintained using standardized queries.
reportingConsiderations: Yearly reports, data storage into regional databases such as PTAGIS.
rolesAndResponsibilities: Field Biologist - oversees field project implementation according to written protocol, logistics, training, and procurement of all field equipment. Resposible for final data qa/qc and draft reporting. Lead Field Technician - responsible for field crew day-to-day activities, and direct sampling of fish Field Technician - applies protocol direct collecting fish.
qualifications: Field Biologist - M.S. degree Lead Field Technician - B.S. degree or significant experience Technician - varies
safetyConsiderations: Swift water rescue courses, first aid training, wilderness first aid, cpr.
name: ISEMP Field Manual of Scientific Protocols for Capture, Handling, and Tagging of Wild Salmonids in the Salmon River Sub-Basin using PIT Tags v1.0
